distributional 0.3.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.2642152 10.0309802
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.003248 1.229050
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.25893582  0.06493093
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.58732881  1.35183988 -0.25493444 -1.09763711 -1.24597910 -1.33544826
#>  [7]  0.19262219  0.12562057 -0.06385765  1.35688997
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 10.766150  9.851478 10.398474 11.216012  9.733731 10.766150 10.108029
#>  [8]  9.923446  9.312616  9.888584
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2231935 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.05845302 10.05013936
variance(dist)
#>            [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,] 1.04737907 0.06426585
#> [2,] 0.06426585 1.31719607
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.01528529
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>             [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -0.4518877 11.502677
#>  [2,]  0.4135561 10.452266
#>  [3,] -1.0361670  9.256348
#>  [4,] -0.6486373 10.804551
#>  [5,]  1.5451831 10.733229
#>  [6,] -0.1639170 10.738570
#>  [7,]  1.0870016  9.969384
#>  [8,] -1.6271009  8.178068
#>  [9,] -1.2101542  9.287250
#> [10,] -0.1601714 11.199155
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2610391 0.0000000
